Post.title: [Go 04]
Post._content:
> go run main.go
ctrl+c

# 
- go
- channelos/signal

<!--more-->






```go
func main() {
	fmt.Println("start")
	errs := make(chan error, 1)
	listenForignal(errs)
	c := <-errs  //
	fmt.Println("terminating:", c)
}

func listenForignal(errChan chan error) {
	go func() {
		c := make(chan os.Signal,1)
		signal.Notify(c, syscall.SIGINT, syscall.SIGTERM)//

		errChan <- fmt.Errorf("%s", <-c)
	}()
}

```

# 
"os/signal"notifystop
    * SIGINT	INTR(Ctrl+C)
    * SIGTERM	 kill pidpidSIGTERM
    * SIGKILL   kill -9 pid 



## SIGINT

go run main.goctrl+c

```
> go run main.go
start
^Cterminating: interrupt
```

## SIGTERM
main.go -o demo
"./"demo
```
go build -o ./demo  main.go
 ./demo 
start
```

 demopid kill pid
```
  ~ ps -A  | grep demo     
14693 ttys000    0:00.00 ./demo
  ~ kill 14693
  ~ ps -A  | grep demo
```



```
 ./demo
start
terminating: terminated
```

------------

2. linuxwin

---

tags:

categories:
  - Tech.
  - back-end
  - golang
date: 2020-05-18T23:51:23+08:00
---



-  zap log 
-  log level  ( debug/warn/info/error)
-  console  lumberjack 
- zap  suger 

<!--more-->

> [ Github  stars  Go ](https://my.oschina.net/u/168737/blog/1536117 "GithubstarsGo")



```go
package logger

import (
	"mywork/demo/internal/config"
	"os"
	"strings"
	"time"
	"go.uber.org/zap"
	"go.uber.org/zap/zapcore"
	"gopkg.in/natefinch/lumberjack.v2"
)


var ZapLogger *zap.Logger
var SugarLogger *zap.SugaredLogger

func InitLogger() {

	logWriter := []zapcore.WriteSyncer{zapcore.AddSync(os.Stdout)}

	if config.Configuration.Logger.File != "" {
		hook := setFileWriter(config.Configuration.Logger.File)
		logWriter = append(logWriter, hook)
	}
	encoderConfig := setEncoder()

	level := getLogLevel(config.Configuration.Logger.Level)

	core := zapcore.NewCore(encoderConfig,
		zapcore.NewMultiWriteSyncer(logWriter...),
		level)

	ZapLogger = zap.New(core, zap.AddCaller()) //log
	// ZapLogger.Debug("POK")                     // ZapLogger sample
	ZapLogger.Info("ZapLogger",
		zap.String("String", "ohoh"),
		zap.Int("Int", 3),
		zap.Duration("backoff", time.Second),
	)
	SugarLogger = ZapLogger.Sugar()
	//SugarLogger.Infof("Success! statusCode = %s for URL %s", "OK", "OK")  // SugarLogger sample

}

func setEncoder() zapcore.Encoder {
	encoderConfig := zap.NewProductionEncoderConfig()
	encoderConfig.EncodeTime = zapcore.ISO8601TimeEncoder
	encoderConfig.EncodeLevel = zapcore.CapitalLevelEncoder
	return zapcore.NewConsoleEncoder(encoderConfig)
}

func setFileWriter(filePath string) zapcore.WriteSyncer {
	lumberJackLogger := &lumberjack.Logger{
		Filename:   filePath,
		MaxSize:    1,
		MaxBackups: 5,
		MaxAge:     30,
		Compress:   false,
	}
	return zapcore.AddSync(lumberJackLogger)
}

func getLogLevel(lv string) zapcore.Level {
	lv = strings.ToLower(lv)
	if level, ok := levelMap[lv]; ok {
		return level
	}
	return zapcore.InfoLevel
}

var levelMap = map[string]zapcore.Level{
	"debug":  zapcore.DebugLevel,
	"info":   zapcore.InfoLevel,
	"warn":   zapcore.WarnLevel,
	"error":  zapcore.ErrorLevel,
}



```

- zap.SugaredLogger

Post._content: {% note info %} MinIOAmazon S3GO SDK" {% endnote %} ## Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3 *Amazon Web Services (AWS) S3(12) Billing alert AWSAWS SDKAWS S3 s3 minIO ## minIO > MinIOAmazon S35TBweb ui :https://docs.min.io/cn/ ### minIO server #### 1.minIO server :https://docs.min.io/cn/minio-quickstart-guide.html - Windows https://dl.min.io/server/minio/release/windows-amd64/minio.exe ``` minio.exe server D:\Photos 9000 RootUser: minioadmin RootPass: minioadmin ``` - Windows docker ``` docker run -p 9000:9000 --name minio1 -v D:\data:/data -e "MINIO_ROOT_USER=AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE" -e "MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD=wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY" minio/minio server /data ``` 1.:http://127.0.0.1:9000/ 2.bucket 3. 4. D:\data Httpswin..:[TLSMinio](https://docs.min.io/cn/how-to-secure-access-to-minio-server-with-tls.html) *HTTPSHTTPSSL/TLS ------------------------------- #### 2.minIO server ``` https://play.min.io Play uses access_key_id Q3AM3UQ867SPQQA43P2F, secret_access_key zuf+tfteSlswRu7BJ86wekitnifILbZam1KYY3TG. GUI:https://play.min.io/ ``` ### minIO client #### mc MinIO Client (mc)lscatcpmirrordifffindUNIXAmazon S3AWS Signature v2v4 [MinIO](https://docs.min.io/cn/minio-client-quickstart-guide.html) #### minIO SDK :[Golang-minIO](https://docs.min.io/cn/golang-client-quickstart-guide.html) - minio-go ``` go get -u github.com/minio/minio-go ``` - endpoint/accessKeyID/secretAccessKey/useSSL ```go minIOSDK https://docs.min.io/cn/golang-client-quickstart-guide.html golang-client-quickstart-guide package main import ( "context" "log" minio "github.com/minio/minio-go/v7" "github.com/minio/minio-go/v7/pkg/credentials" ) //1.minIO server func main() { // endpoint := "play.min.io" // accessKeyID := "Q3AM3UQ867SPQQA43P2F" // secretAccessKey := "zuf+tfteSlswRu7BJ86wekitnifILbZam1KYY3TG" //useSSL := true endpoint := "127.0.0.1:9000" accessKeyID := "AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE" secretAccessKey := "wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY" useSSL := false //error http: server gave HTTP response to HTTPS client // minio client minioClient, err := minio.New(endpoint, &minio.Options{ Creds: credentials.NewStaticV4(accessKeyID, secretAccessKey, ""), Secure: useSSL, }) if err != nil { log.Printf("err\n") log.Fatalln(err) } log.Printf("ok\n") // minioClient // mymusic bucketName := "test11" location := "us-east-1" ctx := context.Background() err = minioClient.MakeBucket(ctx, bucketName, minio.MakeBucketOptions{Region: location}) if err != nil { // exists, errBucketExists := minioClient.BucketExists(ctx, bucketName) if errBucketExists == nil && exists { log.Printf("We already own %s\n", bucketName) } else { log.Printf("err\n") log.Fatalln(err) } } else { log.Printf("Successfully created %s\n", bucketName) } // zip objectName := "ssss.zip" filePath := "./ssss.zip" contentType := "application/zip" // FPutObjectzip n, err := minioClient.FPutObject(ctx, bucketName, objectName, filePath, minio.PutObjectOptions{ContentType: contentType}) if err != nil { log.Fatalln(err) } log.Printf("Successfully uploaded %s of size %d\n", objectName, n) } ``` #### AWS SDK AWS S3SDKminIOserver MinIO:[How to use AWS SDK for Go with MinIO Server](https://docs.min.io/docs/how-to-use-aws-sdk-for-go-with-minio-server.html)AWS ADKV2V2[Overriding Endpoint with Fallback](https://aws.github.io/aws-sdk-go-v2/docs/configuring-sdk/endpoints/)AWS configCredentials ##### Credentials [](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/zh_tw/cli/latest/userguide/cli-configure-files.html) Windows %UserProfile% (c:/users/xxx) Unix $HOME ~ () - AWS CLI - minIO server[AWS CLI with MinIO Server](https://docs.min.io/docs/aws-cli-with-minio.html) aws CLIbuckets ```shell >aws configure AWS Access Key ID [****************MPLE]: Q3AM3UQ867SPQQA43P2F AWS Secret Access Key [****************EKEY]: zuf+tfteSlswRu7BJ86wekitnifILbZam1KYY3TG Default region name [us-east-1]: Default output format [None]: >aws configure set default.s3.signature_version s3v4 >aws --endpoint-url https://play.min.io s3 ls 2021-04-06 00:05:40 00dst1 2021-04-06 00:05:53 00dst2 () ``` ## {% note warning %} {% endnote %} - Hexo Hexo Markdown https://hexo.io/zh-tw/docs/
# 1. Hexo 2. markdown 3. github 4. () ## hexo ### ``` npm Nodehttps://nodejs.org/en/ $ npm install -g hexo-cli $ hexo init $ cd $ npm install ``` ### Run server ```bash $ hexo server http://localhost:4000 ``` More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html) ### ```bash $ hexo version (node:5190) ExperimentalWarning: The fs.promises API is experimental INFO Validating config hexo: 5.1.1 hexo-cli: 4.2.0 os: Darwin 19.0.0 darwin x64 http_parser: 2.8.0 node: 10.16.3 v8: 6.8.275.32-node.54 uv: 1.28.0 zlib: 1.2.11 brotli: 1.0.7 ares: 1.15.0 modules: 64 nghttp2: 1.39.2 napi: 4 openssl: 1.1.1c icu: 64.2 unicode: 12.1 cldr: 35.1 tz: 2019a ``` --- ## ### ```bash $ hexo new "My New Post" ()source/posts .md $ hexo new draft "My New Post" // source/draft .md ``` More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html) ### markdown - https://markdown-editor.github.io/ - vscode vscode markdown preview - --draft ``` hexo s --draft ``` --- ## ### Git - github [yourname].github.io >commit & push >``` >git push -u origin master >``` > - \_config.yml ``` deploy: type: git repo: https://github.com/yourname/yourname.github.io branch: master ``` ### Generate static files ```bash $ hexo generate hexo g public ``` More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html) ### ```bash $ hexo deploy Branch 'master' set up to track remote branch 'master' from 'https://github.com/minilabmemo/minilabmemo.github.io'. INFO Deploy done: git git ``` (ex:heroku) More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html) > configwebsource/theme src branch
branch - src (have all files)
branch - master (only web files) ### https://yourname.github.io/ ### Clean static files ```bash $ hexo clean (db.json) (public) ``` {% label warning@%} --- ## {% note warning %} {% endnote %} - Quick Start Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues) - [HEXO ](https://hexo.io/zh-tw/docs/commands.html)

https://themes.gohugo.io/
hugo 
 github/README 
git submodule add https://github.com/alex-shpak/hugo-book themes/book

> baseURL = "https://xxx.github.io/"  
> languageCode = "zh-tw"
> title = "xxx Blog"

- #domain  xxx  GitHub 
-  
  ex:  theme = "ananke"

>  console  debug 

[ ]

<!--more-->

#### 

 console  console 

Right-click an object in Chrome's console and select Store as Global Variable from the context menu. It will return something like temp1 as the variable name.

Chrome also has a copy() method, so copy(temp1) in the console should copy that object to your clipboard.

```
(9)[{}, {}, {}, {}, {}, {}, {}, {}, {}]
temp1
(9)[{}, {}, {}, {}, {}, {}, {}, {}, {}]
copy(temp1)
JSON.stringify(temp1)
"[{"name":"Cupcake","pri":1,"status":"OPEN","type":"blog","protein":4.3},{"name":"Donut","pri":2,"status":"OPEN","type":"go","protein":4.9}]"
```

[Javascript / Chrome - How to copy an object from the webkit inspector as code
](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10305365/javascript-chrome-how-to-copy-an-object-from-the-webkit-inspector-as-code)

MongoDBNoSQLTable()Collectiondocument
# - docker-compose mongodb - dockerdocker-compose - MongoDB Shell | MongoDB | RDBMS | | | ------------ | ------------ | ------------ | | db | DB| | | collection | Table | | | document | record | | ## 1.mongo docker docker-compose.yml ```yaml version: '3.1' services: mongo: image: mongo ports: - "27017:27017" restart: always environment: MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_USERNAME: root MONGO_INITDB_ROOT_PASSWORD: example ``` ```bash mongo git:(master) docker-compose up -d Creating network "mongo_default" with the default driver Creating mongo_mongo_1 ... done ``` ## 2. mongo ex Robo3T host: localhost, port: 27017 CreateDB"test"Collection"user"Documanet(Json) ```json { "profile" : { "name" : "user1", "gender" : "F", "age" : 18 } } ``` objectID ## 3.mongo shell - shell - mongo 3T ------------ ### #### ``` db.getCollection('user').find({}) ``` #### by_id ``` db.getCollection('user').find({_id:ObjectId("5eaa780f3dfac43981e4412c")}) ``` #### : 1,0 ``` db.getCollection('user').find({},{profile.name:1}) SELECT profile.name FROM user _id_id:0 ``` #### ``` db.getCollection('user').find({"profile.name":"user1"}) ``` #### ``` [gtgteltlte] db.getCollection('user').find({"profile.gender":"F","profile.age":{$gt:2,$lte:18}}) ``` #### ``` UTF-8 A~Z db.getCollection('user').find({"profile.name":{$gt:"a",$lte:"z"}}) ``` #### ``` 1 -1 db.getCollection('user').find({}).sort({name:1}) ``` #### (limit)(skip) ``` db.getCollection('user').find({}).sort({name:1}).skip(0).limit(2) ``` ------------ ### ``` db.getCollection('user').find().count() ``` ------------ ### #### Fwoman ```bash db.getCollection('user').find().forEach( function(d) { if(d.profile.gender=="F"){ d.profile.gender="woman" db.getCollection('user').update({"profile.name":d.profile.name},d); print(d.profile.name+" process change done" ); }; }); ``` #### ```bash db.getCollection('user').find().forEach( function(d) { d.description= d.profile.name+","+d.profile.gender; db.getCollection('user').update({"profile.name":d.profile.name},d); print(d.profile.name+" process change done" ); }); ``` #### ```bash db.getCollection('user').find().forEach( function(d) { delete d.description db.getCollection('user').update({"profile.name":d.profile.name},d); print(d.profile.name+" process change done" ); }); ``` ------------ - mongodocker jsdocker ```bash load("script/Change.js") // mongo 127.0.0.1:27017/test Change.js ``` ------------ mongo golangmongo CRUD

#### fsutil file createnew 
- fsutil file createnew  <FileName.txt> <FileSize(size in bytes)>
```
C:\WINDOWS\system32> fsutil file createnew /?
 : fsutil file createNew <filename> <length>
    : fsutil file createNew C:\testfile.txt 1000
C:\WINDOWS\system32>fsutil file createnew C:\testfile.txt 1000
 C:\testfile.txt 
```
- 
```
fsutil file createnew C:\1kb.txt 1000 //1kb
fsutil file createnew large_10m.txt 10485760   //10*1024*1024
fsutil file createnew large_500m.txt 524288000   //500*1024*1024
fsutil file createnew large_1g.txt 1073741824  //1*1024*1024*1024
```

---

ac mkfile 
- mkfile -n size[b|k|m|g] filename
```
mkfile -n 20m 20mb.txt
```

Post.title: []Prometheus+Grafana
Post._content: {% note info %} Prometheus+Grafana {% endnote %} ## ### Prometheus > metricsKubernetesUber ### Grafana > GrafanaGrafanaGrafana ## ### Prometheus https://prometheus.io/download/ windows zip prometheus.exeprometheus.yml prometheus.exe 9090porthttp://localhost:9090/ port ``` //start.bat prometheus.exe --web.listen-address=:9999 cmd ``` ### grafana https://grafana.com/grafana/download docker ``` docker run -d --name=grafana -p 3000:3000 grafana/grafana ``` http://localhost:3000/ admin #### grafanaprometheus data sources->prometheus Url:http://localhost:9999 Access:BrowserSave & Test --- ## windowsCPU/Network/Memory ### 1.windows_exporter windows https://github.com/martinlindhe/wmi_exporter/releases MSI9182 windows_exporter [Node Exporter Full by Instance ID](https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards/10204) ### 2.prometheus.yml ``` - job_name: 'windows_exporter' static_configs: - targets: ['localhost:9182'] labels: instance: Windows ``` ### 3.grafana [grafana](https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards) - [windows_exporter for Prometheus Dashboard](https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards/13466/) - [Windows Node (fixed for v0.13.0+)](https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards/12422) --- ## Go ### 1.Go ex: [GINprometheus]( https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65608610/how-to-use-gin-as-a-server-to-write-prometheus-exporter-metrics) ```diff import ( "log" "net/http" "github.com/gin-gonic/gin" + "github.com/prometheus/client_golang/prometheus/promhttp" ) func main() { + StartMonitoring("0.0.0.0:8000") select {} } func StartMonitoring(port string) { var p string if port == "" { p = ":8080" } else { p = port } go func() { log.Println("Listening on", p) + http.Handle("/metrics", promhttp.Handler()) log.Fatal(http.ListenAndServe(p, nil)) }() } + func prometheusHandler() gin.HandlerFunc { h := promhttp.Handler() return func(c *gin.Context) { h.ServeHTTP(c.Writer, c.Request) } } ``` listen 8000 ### 2. prometheus.yml weblocalhost:8000 ```yaml - job_name: 'prometheus' # metrics_path defaults to '/metrics' # scheme defaults to 'http'. static_configs: - targets: ['localhost:8000','localhost:8011'] ``` ### 3. localhost:9999Prometheus metrics available for this monitor [prometheus-go](https://docs.signalfx.com/en/latest/integrations/agent/monitors/prometheus-go.html) ### 4. import Go Metrics [grafana](https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards) - [Go Metrics](https://grafana.com/grafana/dashboards/10826) ------------------- ## {% note warning %} {% endnote %} - [PrometheusPrometheus Windows](https://www.mdeditor.tw/pl/pghx/zh-tw) - [Promethuswindows_exporter ](https://www.mdeditor.tw/pl/gmMw/zh-tw) - [ Prometheus Grafana Flask Web App ](https://blog.techbridge.cc/2019/08/26/how-to-use-prometheus-grafana-in-flask-app/) [Grafana | ](https://ab20803.medium.com/grafana-%E5%B0%87%E8%B3%87%E6%96%99%E8%A6%96%E8%A6%BA%E5%8C%96-%E7%B0%A1%E6%98%93%E7%9A%84%E4%BB%8B%E7%B4%B9%E8%88%87%E6%93%8D%E4%BD%9C-4af05a0f4d8c)

### Reactc  recharts

#### 

```
 $ npm install recharts
```

#### 

```
import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip } from 'recharts';
function RenderLineChart() {
  const data = [
    { name: 'Page A', uv: 400, pv: 2400, amt: 2400 },
    { name: 'Page B', uv: 800, pv: 1200, amt: 2400 },
    { name: 'Page C', uv: 900, pv: 3000, amt: 2400 },
  ];
  return (
    <LineChart width={400} height={250} data={data}>
      <XAxis dataKey="name" />
      <YAxis />
      <Tooltip />
      <Line type="monotone" dataKey="uv" stroke="#8884d8" />
      <Line type="monotone" dataKey="pv" stroke="#3f51b5" />
      <Line type="monotone" dataKey="amt" stroke="#666666" />
    </LineChart>
  );
}

//
<RenderLineChart />
```
